task.summary: Default task
initial commit
all tables now have their own controllers and models routes updated
updated routes again and changed teh Controller files to reflect the appropriate model. Also updated teh dependencies and tested the get functions. all that passed are labeled "ok 03-11-2016"
More testing has been done. Routes are updated. Authorization started, needs completing by Monday. Also testing in Postman App needs to be set up so that testing is quicker.
Authentication updated, needs finishing will do tomorrow.
More Authentication. Looks ok but will check over the day to make sure all is correct

After a meeting with Mr.Verlan we agreed that authentication only needed to check for 'super' or 'admin'. The Controllers have been changed to reflect that. 'super' = Idtypes (not list), category(all), users(all). 'admin' = events (not list), participate(all), identify(not list).

tested adduser, addattendance, addparticipant, addevent. fixed issue with authentication for super and admin. working on getAllAttendeesEvents(), cannot get it to work correctly. all bulk functions need to be redone i think. will do tomorrow. also, thinking about the functionality needed for online/offline use....
database updated with cascade working for participate

checked add persons worked. i have changed getEventAttendees sql statement so that it now prints all relevant information rather than eid, pid, uid. this will be more helpful going froward plus will be how bulk lists will be populated. I will work on these today and next week.

i have been looking at the get functions to make them list more coherently. instead of primary keys they should list the informtion from each table. When we add participant (standing outside venue for example) we are adding them using their barcode or id presumably, yet add participant function only asks to add eid, pid, uid. need to check these. i have 2 french tests yesterday and today so i have been a bit distracted but still working!
POSTMAN tests for events, paricipate, person, attend written. will review them as i'm not sure they go far enough.
POSTMAN tests for person add edit delete and 2 gets

after the meeting with Mr.Verlan, and the tests exposed issues with the functions code, i cahnged all the functions to make sure messages read as 'messages'. I changed the error messages to the correct ones (201,404,200), i added ude PDOEXception at the beginning of each model so that it now uses our PDOException and not Slim's. I commented in the code for people that a person can be added multiple times as they can leave and come back in as per Mr.Verlan's request. I changed the double plural in 'peoples' to 'people'. A lot to do still, the tests worked well, clearly!

i added the location header in all POST requests. I need to change PATCH requests to PUT using current code and patch::fromJson command, need to speak to Mr. Verlan as it looks lik ei need to import into my project. Also participate joins are being a pain so i need to talk to him about that as well

All delete and edit functions now have a check that the person/event/ etc exists. It now means that if it does not exist the user will get a 404 error. JsonPatch now loaded into project via composer. Need to look into how it works properly and get that running on all PATCH functions.
included Json PATCH in events edit function. will write the others over the weekend
events, people and users PATCH functions now work with Json PATCH
idtypes edit function now working with the patch.
project and presentation
